org.eclipse.january.dataset

Interface IDataset

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ILazyDataset, IMetadataProvider, INameable, Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CompoundDataset, Dataset, DateDataset
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCompoundDataset, AbstractDataset, BooleanDataset, BooleanDatasetBase, ByteDataset, ComplexDoubleDataset, ComplexFloatDataset, CompoundByteDataset, CompoundDoubleDataset, CompoundFloatDataset, CompoundIntegerDataset, CompoundLongDataset, CompoundShortDataset, DateDatasetImpl, DoubleDataset, FloatDataset, IntegerDataset, LongDataset, ObjectDataset, ObjectDatasetBase, RGBDataset, ShortDataset, StringDataset, StringDatasetBase

    public interface IDataset
extends ILazyDataset
    This interface defines the implementation-independent and generic parts of a dataset.

    The position array used in the getters

      • max

        Number max(boolean... ignoreInvalids)
        Parameters:
        ignoreInvalids - - Can be null, empty, or one or more booleans. By default, all booleans are false. If the first boolean is true, will ignore NaNs and ignore infinities. Use the second boolean to ignore infinities separately.
        Returns:
        Maximum value
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if comparisons are not valid

      • getSlice

        IDataset getSlice(int[] start,
                int[] stop,
                int[] step)
        Description copied from interface: ILazyDataset
        Get a slice of the dataset. The returned dataset is a copied selection of items
        Specified by:
        getSlice in interface ILazyDataset
        Parameters:
        start - specifies the starting indexes (can be null for origin)
        stop - specifies the stopping indexes (can be null for end)
        step - specifies the steps in the slice (can be null for unit steps)
        Returns:
        The dataset of the sliced data

      • getTransposedView

        IDataset getTransposedView(int... axes)
        Permute copy of dataset's axes so that given order is old order: 
          axisPerm = (p(0), p(1),...) => newdata(n(0), n(1),...) = olddata(o(0), o(1), ...)
  such that n(i) = o(p(i)) for all i
        I.e. for a 3D dataset (1,0,2) implies the new dataset has its 1st dimension running along the old dataset's 2nd dimension and the new 2nd is the old 1st. The 3rd dimension is left unchanged.
        Specified by:
        getTransposedView in interface ILazyDataset
        Parameters:
        axes - if zero length then axes order reversed
        Returns:
        remapped view of data

      • getErrors

        IDataset getErrors()
        Description copied from interface: ILazyDataset
        Get the errors, if any. These will be in a shape that can broadcast to the dataset
        Specified by:
        getErrors in interface ILazyDataset
        Returns:
        the error dataset, constructing one if necessary
        Since:
        2.0

        Returns:

      • getErrorArray

        double[] getErrorArray(int... pos)
        Get the error values for a single point in the dataset
        Parameters:
        pos - of the point to be referenced
        Returns:
        the values of the error at this point (can be null when no error defined)
